rvc.ace

Class TCPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • rvc.ace.TCPServer

  • class TCPServer
extends java.lang.Object
    The TCPServer class - implements a server that distributes tasks to clients.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TCPServer.serverResponses
      Enum representing the types of responses the server sends to clients.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPServer

        public TCPServer()
        The TCPServer Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • CreateTasks

        public void CreateTasks()
        CreateTasks method - the method where the list of tasks is created and mapped. For each task available there is a java file that represents the code that will be sent to clients.

      • GetTasksList

        private java.lang.String GetTasksList()
        GetTasksList method - concatenates all the available tasks; on a line are the three characteristics of a task: id, estimated complexity and the date when it was added. Is is used when a client requests the list of tasks to obtain the concatenated string in order to be sent to the client.
        Returns:
        the concatenated string containing all available tasks

      • SendTasksList

        private void SendTasksList()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        SendTasksList method - is responsible if sending the list of available tasks to the client that requested it. It verifies if there are tasks available and sends the appropriate response to the client and if there are tasks available, it gets the concatenated string by calling the GetTasksList method and sends it through a DataOutputStream to the client.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • SendTask

        private void SendTask()
               throws java.io.IOException
        SendTask method - is responsible for sending the java file for the corresponding task that was requested by a client. It first receives the id of the task requested and then it retrieves and sends to the client the information about that task (name of the file corresponding to the task, the extension of the file and the arguments needed to run the file). Afterwards, the file is sent to the client and it is removed from the list of available tasks.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • StartListening

        private void StartListening()
        StartListening method - sets up the connection between server and clients. It receives the requests from clients and calls the appropriate functions to deal with the requests. The method also receives the result of the tasks sent by a client and prints it in the console.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
